title: Kan-o-lantern
description: It wouldn't be Halloween without pumpkins, learn how to carve a spooky pumpkin then get creative by changing the face.
completion_text: That's a nice Kan-o-lantern! But it needs to be lit to be truly spooky, can you figure out how to light the pumpkin by changing some colors, you could also try carving a spookier looking face. Show off your creativity then share your creation.

steps.hint: Let’s set a spooky scene, make it night time - **tape** `background charcoal`
The most distinctive thing about pumpkins is their bright orange skin, to set your fill color  - **tape** `color orange`
We're going to use strokes to build the bulbous shape of the pumpkin, use the darken function to build contrast against the skin - **tape** `stroke darken(orange, 20), 30`
Build your pumpkin slice by slice using ellipses - **tape** `ellipse 180, 140`
It's starting to take shape, add the final slice the same way - **tape** `ellipse 50, 140`
Pumpkins are actually fruits, so we need to draw a green stem - **tape** `color green`
Déplace-toi the cursor to the top of the pumpkin - **tape** `move -20, -180`
Dessine the chunky stem of the pumpkin - **tape** `square 40`
Now we have a fresh pumpkin, we can get to the fun part, carving your design - **tape** `color black`
We're going to give them a face, move the cursor to where the eye will be - **tape** `moveTo 190, 275`
Cut a hole for the first eye - **tape** `circle 15`
Déplace-toi the cursor to where the second eye will be - **tape** `moveTo 310, 275`
Cut the second hole the same size as the first - **tape** `circle 15`
Next we need to give them a mouth - **tape** `moveTo 250, 320`
We need to turn the fill colour off by setting it to null - **tape** `color null`
We'll use un large contour noir for the mouth - **tape** `stroke 15, black`
Finally we will use the arc command to give them a smile. - **tape** `arc 40, 1, 2, true`
